one.block.eosiojava.utilities

Class EOSFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • one.block.eosiojava.utilities.EOSFormatter

  • public class EOSFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a number of helper methods that can be used to convert certain objects to and from formats that are germane to EOS blockchain transactions and the PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format for those objects. It also provides methods to format a serialized transaction into a format that can be submitted to an EOS blockchain.

      • convertPEMFormattedPublicKeyToEOSFormat

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String convertPEMFormattedPublicKeyToEOSFormat(@NotNull
                                                                                         @NotNull java.lang.String publicKeyPEM,
                                                                                         boolean requireLegacyFormOfSecp256k1Key)
                                                                                  throws EOSFormatterError
        This method converts a PEM formatted public key to the EOS format.
        Parameters:
        publicKeyPEM - Public key in the PEM format
        requireLegacyFormOfSecp256k1Key - - If the developer prefers a legacy version of a secp256k1 key that uses a "EOS" prefix.
        Returns:
        EOS formatted public key as string
        Throws:
        EOSFormatterError - if PEM conversion to EOS format fails.

      • convertDERSignatureToEOSFormat

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String convertDERSignatureToEOSFormat(@NotNull
                                                                                @NotNull byte[] signatureDER,
                                                                                @NotNull
                                                                                @NotNull byte[] signableTransaction,
                                                                                @NotNull
                                                                                @NotNull java.lang.String publicKeyPEM)
                                                                         throws EOSFormatterError
        This method converts a signature to a EOS compliant form. The signature to be converted must be an The ECDSA signature that is a DER encoded ASN.1 sequence of two integer fields (see ECDSA-Sig-Value in rfc3279 section 2.2.3). The DER encoded ECDSA signature follows the following format: Byte 1 - Sequence (Should be 30) Byte 2 - Signature length Byte 3 - R Marker (0x02) Byte 4 - R length Bytes 5 to 37 or 38- R Byte After R - S Marker (0x02) Byte After S Marker - S Length Bytes After S Length - S (always 32-33 bytes) Byte Final - Hash Type
        Parameters:
        signatureDER - ECDSA DER encoded signature as byte array
        signableTransaction - Transaction in signable format
        publicKeyPEM - public key in PEM format
        Returns:
        EOS format of signature
        Throws:
        EOSFormatterError - if DER conversion to EOS format fails.

      • convertRawRandSofSignatureToEOSFormat

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String convertRawRandSofSignatureToEOSFormat(@NotNull
                                                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String signatureR,
                                                                                       java.lang.String signatureS,
                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                       @NotNull byte[] signableTransaction,
                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String publicKeyPEM)
                                                                                throws EOSFormatterError
        This method converts a signature to a EOS compliant form. The signature to be converted must be an The ECDSA signature that is a DER encoded ASN.1 sequence of two integer fields (see ECDSA-Sig-Value in rfc3279 section 2.2.3). This method should be used when only the R and S values of the signature are available. The DER encoded ECDSA signature follows the following format: Byte 1 - Sequence (Should be 30) Byte 2 - Signature length Byte 3 - R Marker (0x02) Byte 4 - R length Bytes 5 to 37 or 38- R Byte After R - S Marker (0x02) Byte After S Marker - S Length Bytes After S Length - S (always 32-33 bytes) Byte Final - Hash Type
        Parameters:
        signatureR - R value as BigInteger in string format
        signatureS - S value as BigInteger in string format
        signableTransaction - Transaction in signable format
        publicKeyPEM - Public Key used to sign in PEM format
        Returns:
        EOS format of signature
        Throws:
        EOSFormatterError - if conversion to EOS format fails.

      • extractSerializedTransactionFromSignable

        public static java.lang.String extractSerializedTransactionFromSignable(@NotNull
                                                                        @NotNull java.lang.String eosTransaction)
                                                                 throws EOSFormatterError
        Extract serialized transaction from a signable transaction

        Signable signature structure:

        chainId (64 characters) + serialized transaction + 32 bytes of 0

        Parameters:
        eosTransaction - - the input signable transaction
        Returns:
        - extracted serialized transaction from the input signable transaction
        Throws:
        EOSFormatterError - if input is invalid

      • prepareSerializedTransactionForSigning

        public static java.lang.String prepareSerializedTransactionForSigning(@NotNull
                                                                      @NotNull java.lang.String serializedTransaction,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      @NotNull java.lang.String chainId)
                                                               throws EOSFormatterError
        Preparing signable transaction for signing.

        Signable signature structure:

        chainId + serialized transaction + 32 bytes of 0

        Parameters:
        serializedTransaction - - the serialized transaction to be converted to signable transaction
        chainId - - the chain id will be used inside the signature transaction structure.
        Returns:
        - Signable transaction
        Throws:
        EOSFormatterError - if inputs are invalid

      • decodePublicKey

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull byte[] decodePublicKey(@NotNull
                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String strKey,
                                                       java.lang.String keyPrefix)
                                                throws Base58ManipulationError
        Base58 decodes a public key and validates checksum.
        Parameters:
        strKey - Base58 encoded public key in string format.
        keyPrefix - EOS specific key type prefix (i.e. PUB_R1_, PUB_K1_, or EOS).
        Returns:
        Base58 decoded public key as byte[]
        Throws:
        Base58ManipulationError - if public key decoding fails.
